channel.title: [PI] making a command only work once [PI]
channel.description: I used to code a few years ago and was never good. I really only used tutorials for anything other than basic leeching so I wouldn't even say I used to code lol. Now things are different and I actually want to learn. Like the title says I want to know how to make a certain command, for example, ::starter work only once. Now I know that there is already a starter in Project Insanity, but I want to make a command simillar to ::starter. I already have all the code in except the part to make it only work once.

item.title: [PI] making a command only work once [PI]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Or instead of making a command, and adding more useless data to the player file, you can just give the players the items the first time they log in.

However, you may need to add a variable to say if it’s their first log in or not.

The way Jagex did it (I think) to avoid useless data, is when you reached the end of tutorial island, and you were getting teleported back to the mainland, it did something like this:

player.setLocation(lumbridgeX, lumbridgeY, 0);
player.getInventory().clear();
player.getInventory().add(STARTER);

That way, it could ONLY happen once, because once you leave tutorial island, you can’t come back.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] making a command only work once [PI]

item.title: [PI] making a command only work once [PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

oh… cause i was using this as a base

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pure") && c.pure == 0) { int i = 0; if (c.inWild()) return; c.getPA().addSkillXP((140333), 0); c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 4); c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 6); c.pure = 1; } if (playerCommand.startsWith("pure") && c.pure == 1) { c.sendMessage("You have already used the pure command."); }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] making a command only work once [PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

ooh… true… it’d be like this then

if(playerCommand.StartsWith(“starter”)) && c.hasStarter == 0)
c.getItems().addItem(995, 1000000000);
c.sendMessage(“Thanks for joining Project Genesis!”);
}

Read full topic

if(playerCommand.startsWith("starter")) && if starter == 0 { c.getItems().addItem(0995,10000000); c.sendMessage("Thanks for joining Project Genesis!"); }

[/quote]no[/quote]

yes… it’d be like that… and make another command for the same but if its == 1 then send another message like (" you already got your starter, gtfo");?

item.title: [PI] making a command only work once [PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Yes just add

} else if (token.equals("hasStarter")) { p.hasStarter = Integer.parseInt(token2);
and

characterfile.write("hasStarter = ", 0, 13); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.hasStarter), 0, Integer.toString(p.hasStarter).length()); characterfile.newLine();
and in client.java with the other public ints

then make the command… felt like spoonfeeding lol

Read full topic
